alert.note: Alert for Big Island South; Kohala; Kona; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 06 at 10:50AM HST until January 07 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI AND OAHU... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF MOLOKAI NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A large northwest swell will generate warning level surf today along north and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai and Oahu, and lower to advisory levels for tonight. Advisory level surf is expected through tonight along north and west facing shores of Molokai, north facing shores of Maui and west facing shores of the Big Island. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 15 to 20 feet along north facing shores of Molokai and Maui. Surf of 12 to 16 feet along west facing shores of Molokai. Surf will be 8 to 11 feet along west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Molokai. North facing shores of Maui. West facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution. Boaters should expect recreational surfers and body boarders utilizing harbor channels to access surfing areas.
